instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LSOC_RST_L: What is SMC_LSOC_RST_L? SMC_LSOC_RST_L is a signal that comes out of the trackpad on Macbook Airs that can reset the SMC.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> TSOP error
threads.message:
had liquid damage, got everything working fine except ASD giving me TSOP trackpad error

tried new cable
same error
tried new socket from donor (did loose 1 pad on board, had to run wire)
same

any ideas unless i'm doing the socket wrong?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> TSOP error
threads.message: Check continuity on all pins from motherboard to trackpad........  Also try another trackpad... Voltage on pin 10, 14 and 19... Measure in diode mode on pins 16 and 17...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> TSOP error
threads.message: Only pins of interest are 16 and 17. Did you try another trackpad? All other sensors pass ASD?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> TSOP error
threads.message:
i have previously tried new trackpad cable and trackpads (L2 so take it for what is worth)
i damaged pad for pin 18 <SIGNAL>SMC_LSOC_RST_L</SIGNAL>, had a jumper wire but that seems to have come loose again with all the moment
pins 16 and 17 are soldered ok

yes everything else passes ASD fine

going to find try to find another cable and trackpad again

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> TSOP error
threads.message: had to run cables from J4800 to <CHIP>U5810</CHIP> and now it seems to be good
